result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey D Burgess

records.addlTxt: ref 12-14-2018 Entry; Court further orders that bail is forfeited but held for recompense.
- filed by Attorney Jaspen.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited but held for recompense.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until 12-14-2018 at 1:30 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint PreTrial Services DISCHARGE Report dated November 28, 2018; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Court will address at Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2018.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 11-20-18; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Elizabeth N Larson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 AND 2 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3 AND 4: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned to Branch 4 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
States Supplement to Motion to Admit 911 Call at Trial.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 10-15-18; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen and Mary Scholler.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing held and ruled upon as set forth on the record. Court orders state to file substantive analysis position on 911 calls. Court advises if not done Court will deny 911 calls. Case set for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any 911 or other acts motion must be filed 1 week before the final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
REPLY DEFENSE MOTION TO DISMISS  VINDICTIVE PROSECUTION
Unpublished Decision State V. Clayton Jones , filed and sent to judge for review.
Notice of Response and Response to Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, filed and sent to judge for review.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorneys Sylvan Jaspen and Mary Scholle.  James Ney Law appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for final pretrial. Defense previously filed a Motion to Dismiss. Court vacated Jury Trial date set for 8-29-18. State to submit a response by 9-4-18. Defense to respond, if necessary by 9-11-18. Case adjourned, Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 20, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO DISMISS AMENDED CRIMINAL COMPLAINT - VINDICTIVE PROSECUTION
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript (5 pages) FINAL PRETRIAL, commencing 07/17/18.
Received & Filed, Original Transcript (10 pages) JURY TRIAL, commencing 05-29-2018.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended criminal complaint; copy served on defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended criminal complaint, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty. Bail to remain as previously ordered.  Defense request additional final pretrial. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 6-15-18; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Both parties are ready to proceed. Case passed. Case recalled. Court has reviewed the 911 recordings. Case passed. Case recalled. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial dates in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 17, 2018 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State withdrew their offer to the defendant. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial ON 5-29-18 AT 8:30, Branch 4.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
DEFENSE PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS filed.
Defense Motion in Limine filed.
STATES NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR ADMISSION OF 911 RECORDING

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any 911 or other acts motion must be filed 1 week before the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 29, 2018 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests  more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 5, 2018 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Darneal M.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2018 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  The 6/10/15 jury trial is vacated.

Defendant Jeffrey D Burgess in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
